Name: Giacomo Alessandroni
AboutMe:
I'm Giacomo Alessandroni and I'm degree in Electronic Engineering at Polytechnic University of the Marches, Ancona, Italy, in 1999. Thesis Title: "Hemodynamic Signal Processing, and Comparison of Models of the Carotid Circulation".

I've developed dedicated software for the Bioengineering Department, and tutored students at the Bioengineering Laboratory.

I Teach Electronics and Telecommunication since 1999 and I'm habilitate as engineer since same year; I'm enrolled in the IEEE Signal Processing Society from 2013; and in the Italian Engineers Society since same year.

Since November 2012 I am Pd.D. candidate at University of Urbino. My field of research is the digital signals processing.

Download my latest paper: "SmartRoadSense: Collaborative Road Surface Condition Monitoring"
